intro: Sitanion strictum, commonly known as the narrowleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, disturbed areas and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Sitanion strictum is a herbaceous annual that plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is sometimes considered a weed.
